Description: Intact pottery unguentarium.Neck painted red, the rim dark red. Fine orange fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Of type found in Cyprus. 3rd to 2nd century BC parallels from Hadra, Alexandria (Enklaar 1998, 23, fig.20). Enklaar, A. 1998. Preliminary report on the pottery found at Hadra station, in Empereur, J-Y. (ed.), Commerce et Artisant dans l’Alexandrie Hellénistique et Romaine, Paris, 15-24.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.009)
